channel.name: CBC Toronto CA
channel.title: Room for Rent
channel.desc: Since winning the lottery in high school and blowing all of the money within three years, Mitch has moved back in with his family. When his father retires and starts to talk about downsizing, Mitch gets the idea of renting a room to someone, and that someone is a stranger named Carl. But Carl interferes with Mitch's routine and the initial head-butting between them eventually turns into a major war.

channel.name: CBC Toronto CA
channel.title: Dragons' Den
channel.desc: Two Montreal entrepreneurs hope to be top dog in the Den; a father-daughter duo gears up to impress the Dragons with a shocking demonstration; two business partners try to master the art of the deal.

channel.name: CBC Toronto CA
channel.title: Son of a Critch
channel.desc: Mark fears he'll be outed as a Monarchist when he's chosen to give flowers to a visiting Lady Diana; a gift from Dick comes between Mike Sr. and Mary.

channel.desc: Remy, Mia and Nikhil want Boo to join in playing their imagination games, not realizing they are pulling Boo in too many different directions.

channel.desc: Sophia and Val point fingers at each other when their things go missing from the stables, but when they see a saddle float by in mid-air, they realize something mysterious is afoot.

channel.desc: Layla and Isabel spot the same mysterious phenomenon and head to the Stables to investigate; River and Glacier use magic to try and stop the floatingobjects.

channel.desc: A terrified Nina and Summer return to the cafe to the soundtrack of emergency sirens.

channel.title: Marketplace
channel.desc: Marketplace compares Canada's most stolen vehicles to the same models sold in the UK and reveals how the same vehicles sold overseas have anti-theft measures that aren't provided in Canadian cars.

channel.name: CBC Toronto CA
channel.title: Still Standing
channel.desc: In 2018, Oxford got famous for a 40-metre-wide sinkhole that shut down much of the town; but they have a sense of humor about it and have made shirts, cakes, even Twitter accounts for the sinkhole.

channel.title: Land and Sea
channel.desc: Some Mi'kmaw knowledge keepers and botanists in Cape Breton are making it their mission to share the healing power of plants; they say learning about Mi'kmaw medicine is a way to connect generations.
